data.title: Use Shift+Ctrl+ instead of cmd-shift- in documentation when applicable
data.body:
On non-OS X systems, please use Shift+Ctrl+ etc. in documentation instead of cmd-shift-.

For example welcome.md refers to cmd-shift-p but on Linux on a non-Apple based machine all the menu items show shortcuts called Shift+Ctrl+P. To properly match documentation with offered menu items and shortcuts, please use the correct shortcut format in documentation included in a build for Linux on non-Apple based machines.

data.title: Multi-select + X deletes one character too far
data.body:
If you select many patterns with `cmd+D`, extend the selection by one character, then (in vim mode) press `x`, it will delete 1 character past your selection:

![delete_one_too_far](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1189716/3020259/88ccf062-df9c-11e3-8627-b20475d7a290.gif)

It should only delete the actual selection.

data.title: Add support for block / column selection
data.body:
In plenty editors, doing `left-alt` (left option) and selecting text will take a slice of that text:

![sublime](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1189716/3020145/21a1ced6-df9b-11e3-9cf2-70371ca5fee1.gif)

Notice that only characters are selected, empty lines are ignored. Also, after selecting with `left-alt`, there should be multi-cursors at the end of each selection:

![reslice](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1189716/3020149/2d06c1c8-df9b-11e3-9a39-226039d0f777.gif)

The GIF are from Sublime, the same behavior is observed in TextMate, IntelliJ, vim (visual selection).

The current behavior in Atom is to perform a normal text selection:

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1189716/3020155/3bbc4512-df9b-11e3-97a8-1acab2dd686f.gif)

data.title: cannot update to runcoderun 0.5.0 from 0.4.0 in Atom 0.96.0
data.body:
i have updated to Atom 0.96.0, i'm on a 27" iMac with an intel core i7 processor, 16 GB of RAM and the latest update of Mac OS X 10.9.3.

i cannot update to the latest version of runcoderun 0.5.0 from 0.4.0 under the above set-up. 

**expected behavior —**

either from the Settings pane in Atom 0.96.0 > Packages, or in the Settings pane > the RunCodeRun package, click on update to install, and it should install fine.

**observed issue —**

when i attempt this, whether updating from the Settings pane (cmd-,) > Packages or from Settings pane > RunCodeRun, i get the following error coming up in the Developer Tools pane (comes up due to error, usually comes up on cmd-alt.-i) —

```
Error serializing package 'runcoderun' TypeError: Cannot call method 'serialize' of null
  at Object.module.exports.serialize (/Users/yuetsu/.atom/packages/runcoderun/lib/runcoderun.coffee:25:42)
  at Package.module.exports.Package.serialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:363:97)
  at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.deactivatePackage (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package-manager.js:132:65)
  at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.update (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/settings-view/lib/package-manager.js:177:23)
  at PackageUpdateView.module.exports.PackageUpdateView.upgrade (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/settings-view/lib/package-update-view.js:154:34)
  at HTMLButtonElement.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/settings-view/lib/package-update-view.js:73:24)
  at HTMLButtonElement.jQuery.event.dispatch (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4676:9)
  at HTMLButtonElement.elemData.handle (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4360:28)
 /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:366
module.exports.Package.serialize /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:366
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'destroy' of null runcoderun.coffee:21
```

i cannot get this package to update. any suggestions, please?

i have also filed this as an issue with the runcoderun developer, @jgarth - https://github.com/jgarth/runcoderun/issues/3 .

best,

—  faddah wolf
     portland, oregon

data.title: "Update download failed"
data.body:
**Env***
MBP 15-inch / OS X 10.9.2
Atom Version 0.95.0

**Repo**
Always

**Steps**
1. Click Atom > 'Check for Update'

**Actual Result**
'Update download failed'

**Additional Details**
Issue doesn't reproduce after manually installing Atom Version 0.96.0 downloaded from https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/tag/v0.96.0 , though that might be because there is no newer builds. I noticed that Download button at https://atom.io/ no longer starts download, but instead links to https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/tag/v0.96.0

data.title: Add proxy icon to title bar in OS X windows
data.body:
There has been people on the [forums](http://discuss.atom.io/t/support-mac-os-x-title-bar-proxy-icons/3329) who have expressed the desire for this feature.

More details of what a proxy icon is and how it works can be found in [OS X Human Interface Guidelines: Windows](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/userexperience/conceptual/applehiguidelines/Windows/Windows.html) under "The Proxy Icon and Title Bar Menu" (I could not figure out how to link to the subheading).

Here's a gif of how the proxy icon works when cmd+clicking:

![proxy icon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1301625/3016609/3253d6b4-df70-11e3-808c-12fba38ad58c.gif)

Now what?

data.title: accentuated character ê freezes the editor
data.body:
When trying to type the character ê (by typing firth the ^ key then  the e key) the editor first shows the sequence ê^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ and then freezes (or sometime starts to behave weirdly, for example by inserting characters at a different position than where the cursor blinks).
I'm using Atom.io version 0.95.0 on a 10.9.2 Mac OS with a French keyboard.

data.title: Atom version not properly displayed
data.body:
@probablycorey ask me to report this issue from [discuss.atom.io](http://discuss.atom.io/t/atom-version-not-properly-displayed/9390) 

> I managed to build a working version of Atom for Gentoo Linux but I can't get the
> proper Atom version in Help menu (Version 0.1.0 is displayed instead of 0.96.0).
> 
> I tried to understand the way the menu was generated and, if I understood correctly,  it seems to read Atom package.json version which seems good :
> 
> ``` json
> {
>   "name": "atom",
>   "productName": "Atom",
>   "version": "0.96.0-7410f9a",
>   "description": "A hackable text editor for the 21st Century.",
>   "main": "./src/browser/main.js",
>   "repository": {
>     "type": "git",
>     "url": "https://github.com/atom/atom.git"
>   },
>   ...
> }
> ```
> 
> Have I missed something ?

I should mention that atom-shell is build standalone and I run atom this way : 

```
$ /usr/share/atom-shell/atom /usr/share/atom 
$ echo $ATOM_RESOURCE_PATH
/usr/share/atom
```

---

Atom Commit: 7410f9a
OS Version: Gentoo Linux ([Unofficial overlay build](https://github.com/aegypius/overlay/tree/master/app-editors/atom) - aegypius/overlay#7)

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**
1. Launch Atom
2. Click Help Menu 

**What is the expected result?**

Version 0.96.0

**What happens instead?**

Version 0.1.0 is displayed

data.title: Can't install atom behind proxy
data.body:
Trying to install Atom 0.95.0 behind a squid:

```
$ uname -a
Linux ... 3.14.2-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Sun Apr 27 11:28:44 CEST 2014 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ npm --version
1.4.9

$ ping proxy
PING proxy.(...).de (...) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from (...): icmp_seq=1 ttl=63 time=0.618 ms

$ echo $http_proxy
http://proxy:3128

$ echo $https_proxy
https://proxy:3128

$ npm config get proxy
http://proxy:3128/

$ npm config get https-proxy
https://proxy:3128/

$ npm config get registry
http://registry.npmjs.org/

$ script/build
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/normalize-package-data/-/normalize-package-data-0.2.12.tgz
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/read-package-json/-/read-package-json-1.1.8.tgz
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/read-package-json/-/read-package-json-1.1.8.tgz
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/read-package-json/-/read-package-json-1.1.8.tgz
npm ERR! network tunneling socket could not be established, cause=139743551592256:error:140770FC:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:unknown protocol:s23_clnt.c:787:
npm ERR! network 
npm ERR! network This is most likely not a problem with npm itself
npm ERR! network and is related to network connectivity.
npm ERR! network In most cases you are behind a proxy or have bad network settings.
npm ERR! network 
npm ERR! network If you are behind a proxy, please make sure that the
npm ERR! network 'proxy' config is set properly.  See: 'npm help config'

npm ERR! System Linux 3.14.2-1-ARCH
npm ERR! command "/usr/bin/node" "/usr/bin/npm" "--userconfig=/home/benny/Desktop/atom-0.95.0/.npmrc" "install" "--quiet"
npm ERR! cwd /home/benny/Desktop/atom-0.95.0/build
npm ERR! node -v v0.10.28
npm ERR! npm -v 1.4.9
npm ERR! code ECONNRESET
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/normalize-package-data/-/normalize-package-data-0.2.12.tgz
npm ERR! fetch failed https://registry.npmjs.org/normalize-package-data/-/normalize-package-data-0.2.12.tgz
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Additional logging details can be found in:
npm ERR!     /home/benny/Desktop/atom-0.95.0/build/npm-debug.log
npm ERR! not ok code 0
```

Any ideas?

data.title: atom should not override Cocoa text system's buildin word auto-completion
data.body:
Mac  has a system-wide word auto-completion key-bindings: `command + .` or `F5`. The TextEdit.app and Mail.app and Chrome(omnibox, the address bar) and many other Cocoa App supports this feature. That is: you can input partial of the word, press  `Command + .`  , a auto-completion drop-down should be triggered,then you can select the target word.

This cocoa text auto-completion is very important for a foreign writers.

ref: [hallelujah_autocompletion](http://daringfireball.net/2006/10/hallelujah_autocompletion)

![cocoa-text-auto-complete](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/112451/3009833/feae0c38-df08-11e3-8d40-e980e4606a62.png)

data.title: :memo: Unify the two contributing documents
data.body: Both documents had some really great stuff to them, but there was too much overlap. I did my best to unify them into one document, taking the best features of each.

data.body:
I am using arch linux with subtle as my window-manager. `ctrl+c` (copy) does not copy text for me, so the content of my clipboard does not get changed if I press `ctrl+c`. The funny thing is that `ctrl+x` (cut) works just fine..

Can you give my any tips on how to debug this further?

[Original issue in atom-keymap](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/18)

data.title: Packaging Atom for Debian
data.body:
Let's discuss getting Atom into Debian here, before we start trying to file a ton of issues elsewhere.

It sounds like even though the vast majority of these repos have a LICENSE file, Debian **requires** license information in every _source file_, right @joergff? Let's talk about alternatives or how we can work around this, because Atom is composed of literally hundreds of modules, and asking them to all adhere to this requirement is intractably difficult, for almost no practical benefit. 

One possibility that comes to my head if it truly isn't possible to negotiate this requirement, is to write a tool to mirror all of the atom repos to another GitHub org, but to run a post-processing tool on the sources to add the copyright header. Thoughts?

/cc @kevinsawicki @probablycorey @thedaniel, who were closing some of these issues earlier

data.title: Is it possible to port bindings.js from Node?
data.body: Node has an interesting feature in https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-bindings which allows you to call native binary libs from V8 code. I haven't reviewed Atom's code enough to know how easy or hard it would be to port or calque this feature to the Atom codebase, so that plugin authors could use it to get functionality from existing installed DLLs / .so's ... However, as a potential plugin author, I'd be really interested in the ability to do something similar to this in an easy and style-consistent way.

data.title: styling of property names and property values
data.body:
Not sure if this issue belongs in this **atom/atom** repo or the [**atom/language-less**](https://github.com/atom/language-less) repo, but...

On the `text-align` property, the values `left`, `right`, and `center` are incorrectly styled with the class `property-name`. Only the value `justify` gets styled with the correct class `property-value`.

I would submit a pull request but I have no idea where to even begin to fix this. I don't know a lot about JavaScript.

The source code of the editor window:

![screen shot 2014-05-18 at 10 53 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1362083/3007759/df14f16e-de9c-11e3-8e0e-529e473b35ec.png)

The editor window (syntax theme is [Solarized Dark](https://github.com/atom/solarized-dark-syntax)):

![screen shot 2014-05-18 at 10 52 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1362083/3007760/e1a8859e-de9c-11e3-8c08-ef9547e93673.png)

EDIT

The `center` property value is _not_ styled with the `property-name` class; that was my mistake. It is, however, incorrectly styled with the classes `keyword control html elements` classes, probably due to the [deprecated `center` element](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/center) in HTML.

data.title: Make instructions for manual VS path more accurate
data.body:
Move the line number for the variable close to the actual current location.
Add a note to not to include unescaped backward slashes as they would appear in normal Windows paths.

data.title: Find And Replace doesn't respect .gitignore if root is parent
data.body:
Setup:
1. `mkdir projects`
2. `cd projects`
3. `git clone rails/rails`
4. `atom .`
5. `cmd+shift+f`
6. FIND: `rails`
7. REPLACE: `burp`
8. PATH: `rails`
   9 `enter`

You'll find that your remote paths now say:

```
origin  git@github.com:burp/burp.git (fetch)
```

data.title: atom is currently unsuable under linux
data.body:
Since the keybinds are a mess. For example:
- `CTRL+LEFT`
- `CTRL+RIGHT`
- `CTRL+SHIFT+Left`
- `CTRL+SHIFT+RIGHT`
- `CTRL+END`
- `CTRL+POS1`
- ...

don't work currently.

data.title: Performance loss after a couple of hours of usage
data.body: I've been using Atom for a while, and I am impressed that it works like a charm. The only thing that it's happening is that after some hours, by using the editor on a no too big project, the performance gets decreased notably, so when you press the arrow keys, the cursor takes like 1 second to move. I am not sure how I can be more specific in here, because an animated GIF wont help to illustrate this situation. Is there anyone that is suffering the same things? (Btw, I do have an iMac, i5, 16GBs). I am only able to fix this by closing all windows and restarting Atom. Thanks!

data.title: Default Directory
data.body:
I think it would be cool to have an option to set a default directory if atom is invoked with no arguments. If no value was entered then atom would behave as it does now. There was some talk about removing the Project Home option in the settings dialog but I would vote that it be changed to mean the default directory for projects. This way i just launch atom and I'll be staring at all my projects. I understand this can be done many ways, even with an alias. For now I added this simple hack to atom.sh just under the getopts section.

if [ -z $1];
then 
cd /dir/containing/all/projects
fi

I thought about just adding whatever file contains the "Project Home" entry as a source in atom.sh and calling the value here if not empty. Any thoughts on a more elegant solution?

Thanks!

data.title: [devtools] Debugging gets silently disabled
data.body:
React editor. Happened while trying to debug #2186

Very specific steps to reproduce:

1) Open up `app/src/editor.js` in _Sources_
2) Place a breakpoint on the first line after `Editor.prototype.insertText = ...`
3) Paste using `Ctrl+V`

This breakpoint should fire on every insert. Even if I stop trying to paste, and try to input a single character, insertText should fire, thus this breakpoint should too.

data.title: Cannot show indentation correctly in a file formatted by gofmt (golang)
data.body:
As can be seen in the attached screenshot Atom cannot show indentation correctly. The opened file is formatted using gofmt by the following command:
`gofmt example.go > a.go`
Gedit and Emacs show indentation as 8 characters long but Atom shows is as 2 characters long.

OS: GNU/Linux
Atom: Version 0.96.0
![atom-emacs-gedit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7403156/3005771/1295dcf2-ddf2-11e3-951b-2910a6183b9f.png)

data.title: [Windows]missing encoding(decoding) when paste from clipboard
data.body:
I garbled when pasting of multi-byte characters, such as Chinese and Japanese(and so on)

| copy -> paste | result |
| --- | --- |
| Atom -> Atom | Garbage |
| Atom-> other | Safe |
| Other -> Atom | Garbage |

and check `require('clipboard').readText()` on console: Not garbled.

(I have not checked yet `atom.clipboard`, but it calls `require('clipboard').readText()`.)
[disscus link](http://discuss.atom.io/t/windows-missing-encoding-decoding-when-paste-from-clipboard/9486)

data.title: Add shortcuts for select page up and select a page down
data.body:
In Linux editors the shortcut control+shift+page down and control+shift+page up selects a page of text.
It would be really nice if Atom could have this keybinding.
Thanks you!
